abs.description: Returns the absolute value of a number. The absolute value of a number is the number without its sign.

acos.description: Returns the arccosine, or inverse cosine, of a number. The arccosine is the angle whose cosine is number. The returned angle is given in radians in the range 0 (zero) to pi.

acosh.description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic cosine of a number. The number must be greater than or equal to 1. The inverse hyperbolic cosine is the value whose hyperbolic cosine is number, so ACOSH(COSH(number)) equals number.

aggregate.description: Returns an aggregate in a list or database. The AGGREGATE function can apply different aggregate functions to a list or database with the option to ignore hidden rows and error values.

pi.description: Returns the number 3.14159265358979, the mathematical constant pi, accurate to 15 digits.

switch.description: evaluates one value (called the expression) against a list of values, and returns the result corresponding to the first matching value. If there is no match, an optional default value may be returned.

sumsq.description: Returns the sum of the squares of the supplied arguments.

bitor.description: Performs a bitwise OR operation on two integer values and returns the result.

gammaln.precise.description: Returns the natural logarithm of the Gamma function, Γ(number).

permut.description: Returns the number of permutations for a given number of objects (ordered arrangements).

imcosh.description: Returns the hyperbolic cosine of a complex number provided as text.

negbinomdist.description: Returns the negative binomial distribution (probability) for a given number of failures before a specified number of successes.

isna.description: Returns TRUE if the value is the #N/A error; otherwise returns FALSE.

imcsc.description: Returns the cosecant of a complex number provided as text.

row.description: Returns the row number of a reference. If omitted, returns the row number of the cell containing the formula.

average.description: Returns the average (arithmetic mean) of the supplied numbers.

count.description: Counts how many numbers are in the list of supplied arguments.

countif.description: Counts the number of cells within a range that meet the given condition.

left.description: Returns the first character or characters in a text string, based on the number of characters you specify.

round.description: Rounds a number to a specified number of digits.

len.description: Returns the number of characters in a text string.

sumif.description: Adds the cells specified by a given condition or criteria.

today.description: Returns the current date as a serial number. The value updates when the worksheet is recalculated or opened.

sumifs.description: Adds the cells in a range that meet multiple criteria.

averageifs.description: Returns the average of cells that meet multiple criteria.

maxifs.description: Returns the maximum value among cells specified by a set of conditions.

hex2bin.description: Converts a hexadecimal number to binary.

month.description: Returns the month of a date represented by a serial number (1-12).

exp.description: Returns e raised to the power of a given number.

sin.description: Returns the sine of the given angle (in radians).

irr.description: Returns the internal rate of return for a series of cash flows.

second.description: Returns the seconds of a time value, a number from 0 to 59.

pv.description: Calculates the present value of an investment based on periodic, constant payments and a constant interest rate.

odd.description: Rounds a number up to the nearest odd integer.

hex2dec.description: Converts a hexadecimal number to decimal.

hex2oct.description: Converts a hexadecimal number to octal.

quotient.description: Returns the integer portion of a division.

day.description: Returns the day of the month (1â€“31) from a date.

imaginary.description: Returns the imaginary coefficient of a complex number given as text.

oct2hex.description: Converts an octal number to hexadecimal.

tbilleq.description: Returns the bond-equivalent yield for a Treasury bill.

tbillyield.description: Returns the yield for a Treasury bill given settlement, maturity and price/discount.

tbillprice.description: Returns the price per $100 face value for a Treasury bill given settlement, maturity and discount.

mode.description: Returns the most frequently occurring value in a range or list of arguments.

ln.description: Returns the natural logarithm of a number.

year.description: Returns the year corresponding to a date.

iferror.description: Returns a value you specify if a formula evaluates to an error; otherwise returns the result of the formula.

imabs.description: Returns the absolute value (modulus) of a complex number given as text.

ppmt.description: Returns the payment on the principal for a given period for an investment.

gammaln.description: Returns the natural logarithm of the Gamma function, Γ(number).

bitlshift.description: Shifts bits of a number to the left by a specified number of positions.

bitrshift.description: Shifts bits of a number to the right by a specified number of positions.

rand.description: Returns an evenly distributed random real number greater than or equal to 0 and less than 1.

right.description: Returns the last character or characters in a text string, based on the number of characters you specify.

gcd.description: Returns the greatest common divisor of two or more integers.

imconjugate.description: Returns the complex conjugate of a complex number given as text.

cos.description: Returns the cosine of a given angle (in radians).

days.description: Returns the number of days between two dates.

iserror.description: Returns TRUE if the value is any error value except #N/A.

stdev.description: Estimates the standard deviation based on a sample.

trim.description: Removes extra spaces from text, leaving single spaces between words.

bitxor.description: Performs a bitwise XOR operation on two integer values and returns the result.

log10.description: Returns the base-10 logarithm of a number.

tan.description: Returns the tangent of a given angle (in radians).

imreal.description: Returns the real coefficient of a complex number given as text.

rank.eq.description: Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers; identical to RANK but ties receive the same rank (RANK.EQ).

minute.description: Returns the minute component of a time value, a number from 0 to 59.

imln.description: Returns the natural logarithm of a complex number given as text.

norm.s.inv.description: Returns the inverse of the standard normal cumulative distribution (z-score) for a given probability.

accrint.description: Returns the accrued interest for a security that pays periodic interest.

weekday.description: Returns the day of the week corresponding to a date, typically 1 (Sunday) through 7 (Saturday) depending on return_type.

imlog2.description: Returns the base-2 logarithm of a complex number given as text.

oct2bin.description: Converts an octal number to binary.

norm.dist.description: Returns the normal distribution for the specified mean and standard deviation.

rank.description: Returns the rank of a number in a list of numbers (ties averaged in older Excel versions).

sign.description: Returns the sign of a number: 1 (positive), 0 (zero), or -1 (negative).

asin.description: Returns the arcsine, or inverse sine, of a number. The result is in radians.

sln.description: Returns the straight-line depreciation of an asset for one period.

sqrtpi.description: Returns the square root of pi times a number.

complex.description: Returns a complex number as text given real and imaginary coefficients and an optional suffix.

imexp.description: Returns the exponential of a complex number given as text.

ipmt.description: Returns the interest payment for a given period of an investment.

fv.description: Returns the future value of an investment based on periodic, constant payments and a constant interest rate.

npv.description: Calculates the net present value of an investment based on a discount rate and a series of future payments.

exact.description: Checks whether two text strings are exactly the same (case-sensitive).

dec2oct.description: Converts a decimal number to octal.

concatenate.description: Joins several text items into one text string.

harmean.description: Returns the harmonic mean of a data set.

yielddisc.description: Returns the annual yield for a discounted security.

cot.description: Returns the cotangent of an angle (in radians).

bin2dec.description: Converts a binary number to decimal.

gamma.description: Returns the Gamma function value for a number.

time.description: Returns the decimal number for a particular time.

atanh.description: Returns the inverse hyperbolic tangent of a number.

normsdist.description: Returns the standard normal cumulative distribution for a given z-score (legacy NORMSDIST).

cumipmt.description: Returns the cumulative interest paid on a loan between two periods.

imcos.description: Returns the cosine of a complex number supplied as text.

pmt.description: Calculates the payment for a loan based on constant payments and a constant interest rate.

imtanh.description: Returns the hyperbolic tangent of a complex number supplied as text.

rri.description: Returns the equivalent interest rate for the growth of an investment.

fact.description: Returns the factorial of a number.

date.description: Returns the serial number of a particular date.

nominal.description: Converts an effective annual interest rate to a nominal rate.
